title: Population of Michigan , by race and ethnicity 2018
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of residents for 8 number of Races.
The Number of residents is appeared to be the highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
The difference of Number of residents between the highest and lowest Race is 7472757.0.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Race in the x axis and Number of residents in the y axis.
The Number of residents is appeared to be the highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of residents for 8 number of Races.
The Number of residents is appeared to be the highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
The difference of Number of residents between the highest and lowest Race is 7472757.0.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of residents for 8 number of Races.
The Number of residents is highest at Race White alone and lowest at Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone.
The difference of Number of residents between the highest and lowest Race is 7472757.0.

Race White alone is higher than any other Races with value 7476047.0, followed by Black or African American alone, and Hispanic or Latino (of any race). Down to Race Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander alone with the lowest value 3290.0.
The average Number of residents in all 8 Races is 1249489.38.
Summing up the values of all Races, we get total 9995915.0.
